org.rapidcontext.util

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rapidcontext.util.FileUtil

  • public abstract class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of utility methods for handling files.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Per Cederberg

    • Method Detail

      • canonical

        public static java.io.File canonical(java.io.File file)
        Attempts to resolve a file to a canonical file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to resolve
        Returns:
        the canonical file, or the original file if the resolution failed

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.File src,
                        java.io.File dst)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a file or a directory. Directories are copied recursively and file modification dates are kept. If the executable bit is set on the source file, that bit will also be set on the destination file.
        Parameters:
        src - the source file or directory
        dst - the destination file or directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some file couldn't be copied

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.InputStream is,
                        java.io.File dst)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the data from an input stream to a destination file. If the file exists, it will be overwritten. The destination file parent directory must have been created or the copy will fail. The input stream will be closed by this function.
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream to read
        dst - the destination file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input stream couldn't be read or if the destination file couldn't be written

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.InputStream is,
                        java.io.OutputStream os)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the data from an input stream to an output stream. Both the streams will be closed when this function returns.
        Parameters:
        is - the input stream to read
        os - the output stream to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input stream couldn't be read or if the output stream couldn't be written

      • delete

        public static void delete(java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes a file or a directory. This function will delete all files and sub-directories inside a directory recursively.
        Parameters:
        file - the file or directory to delete
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some files couldn't be deleted
        See Also:
        deleteFiles(File)

      • deleteFiles

        public static void deleteFiles(java.io.File dir)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes all files in a directory, but leaving the directory otherwise unmodified. This function will delete any sub-directories recursively.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to clean
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some files couldn't be deleted
        See Also:
        delete(File)

      • deleteEmptyDirs

        public static void deleteEmptyDirs(java.io.File dir)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes all empty directories in a directory, but leaves the directory itself unmodified. This method will remove any empty directories recursively, making it possible to remove a tree of empty directories.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to clean
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if some files couldn't be deleted
        See Also:
        deleteFiles(File)

      • tempDir

        public static java.io.File tempDir(java.lang.String prefix,
                                   java.lang.String suffix)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new temporary directory. If a temporary directory has been set, it will be used. Otherwise the default temporary directory will be used.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the directory name prefix
        suffix - the directory name suffix
        Returns:
        a new empty temporary directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the temporary directory couldn't be created

      • setTempDir

        public static void setTempDir(java.io.File dir)
        Sets the temporary directory to use.
        Parameters:
        dir - the new temporary directory

      • tempFile

        public static java.io.File tempFile(java.lang.String prefix,
                                    java.lang.String suffix)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new temporary file. If a temporary directory has been set, it will be used. Otherwise the default temporary directory will be used. The generated file is guaranteed to keep the same file extension (suffix) as the specified one.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the file name prefix
        suffix - the file name suffix (extension)
        Returns:
        a new empty temporary file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the temporary file couldn't be created

      • tempFile

        public static java.io.File tempFile(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new temporary file. If a temporary directory has been set, it will be used. Otherwise the default temporary directory will be used. The generated file is guaranteed to keep the same file extension as the desired file name.
        Parameters:
        name - the desired file name
        Returns:
        a new empty temporary file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the temporary file couldn't be created
